verses.verse: <S%H6256>Why<s%>, seeing times are not <S%H6845>hidden<s%> from the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%>, do they that <S%H3045>know<s%> him not <S%H2372>see<s%> his <S%H3117>days<s%>?
Some <S%H5381>remove<s%> the <S%H1367>landmarks<s%>; they violently take <S%H1497>away<s%> <S%H5739>flocks<s%>, and feed <S%H7462>there<s%>.
They drive <S%H5090>away<s%> the <S%H2543>donkey<s%> of the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%>, they <S%H2254>take<s%> the <S%H490>widow<s%>'s <S%H7794>ox<s%> for a <S%H2254>pledge<s%>.
They <S%H5186>turn<s%> the <S%H34>needy<s%> out of the <S%H1870>way<s%>: the <S%H6041>poor<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%> <S%H2244>hide<s%> themselves <S%H3162>together<s%>.

<S%H6501>Behold<s%>, as wild donkeys in the <S%H4057>desert<s%>, go they <S%H3318>forth<s%> to their <S%H6467>work<s%>; rising some <S%H7836>time<s%> for a <S%H2964>prey<s%>: the <S%H6160>wilderness<s%> yields <S%H3899>food<s%> for them and for their <S%H5288>sons<s%>.
They <S%H7114>reap<s%> every one his <S%H1098>corn<s%> in the <S%H7704>field<s%>: and they <S%H3953>gather<s%> the <S%H3754>vintage<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>.
They cause the <S%H6174>naked<s%> to <S%H3885>lodge<s%> without <S%H3830>clothing<s%>, that they have no <S%H3682>covering<s%> in the <S%H7135>cold<s%>.
They are <S%H7372>wet<s%> with the <S%H2230>showers<s%> of the <S%H2022>mountains<s%>, and <S%H2263>embrace<s%> the <S%H6697>rock<s%> for want of a <S%H4268>shelter<s%>.
They <S%H1497>pluck<s%> the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%> from the <S%H7699>breast<s%>, and take a <S%H2254>pledge<s%> of the <S%H6041>poor<s%>.
They cause him to <S%H1980>go<s%> <S%H6174>naked<s%> without <S%H3830>clothing<s%>, and they take <S%H5375>away<s%> the <S%H6016>sheaf<s%> from the <S%H7457>hungry<s%>;
Which make <S%H6671>oil<s%> <S%H996>inside<s%> their <S%H7791>walls<s%>, and <S%H1869>tread<s%> their <S%H3342>winepresses<s%>, and suffer <S%H6770>thirst<s%>.

<S%H4962>Men<s%> <S%H5008>groan<s%> from out of the <S%H5892>city<s%>, and the <S%H5315>soul<s%> of the <S%H2491>wounded<s%> cries <S%H7768>out<s%>: yet <S%H433>God<s%> <S%H7760>lays<s%> not wickedness to <S%H8604>them<s%>.
They are of those that <S%H4775>rebel<s%> against the <S%H216>light<s%>; they <S%H5234>know<s%> not the <S%H1870>ways<s%> <S%H3427>there<s%>, nor stay in the paths <S%H5410>there<s%>.
The <S%H7523>murderer<s%> <S%H6965>rising<s%> with the <S%H216>light<s%> <S%H6991>kills<s%> the <S%H6041>poor<s%> and <S%H34>needy<s%>, and in the <S%H3915>night<s%> is as a <S%H1590>thief<s%>.

The <S%H5869>eye<s%> also of the <S%H5003>adulterer<s%> <S%H8104>waits<s%> for the <S%H5399>twilight<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, No <S%H5869>eye<s%> shall <S%H7789>see<s%> <S%H5643>me<s%>: and disguises his <S%H6440>face<s%>.

In the <S%H2822>dark<s%> they dig <S%H2864>through<s%> <S%H1004>houses<s%>, which they had <S%H2856>marked<s%> for themselves in the <S%H3119>daytime<s%>: they <S%H3045>know<s%> not the <S%H216>light<s%>.
For the <S%H1242>morning<s%> is to them even <S%H3162>as<s%> the shadow of <S%H6757>death<s%>: if one <S%H5234>know<s%> <S%H1091>them<s%>, they are in the terrors of the shadow of <S%H6757>death<s%>.

He is <S%H7031>swift<s%> as the <S%H6440>waters<s%>; their <S%H2513>portion<s%> is <S%H7043>cursed<s%> in the <S%H776>earth<s%>: he <S%H6437>beholds<s%> not the <S%H1870>way<s%> of the <S%H3754>vineyards<s%>.
<S%H6723>Drought<s%> and <S%H2527>heat<s%> <S%H1497>consume<s%> the <S%H7950>snow<s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%>: so does the <S%H7585>grave<s%> those which have <S%H2398>sinned<s%>.

The <S%H7358>womb<s%> shall <S%H7911>forget<s%> <S%H7415>him<s%>; the worm shall feed <S%H4988>sweetly<s%> on <S%H2142>him<s%>; he shall be no more remembered; and <S%H5766>wickedness<s%> shall be <S%H7665>broken<s%> as a <S%H6086>tree<s%>.
He evil <S%H7462>entreats<s%> the <S%H6135>childless<s%> that <S%H3205>bears<s%> <S%H3190>not<s%>: and does not good to the <S%H490>widow<s%>.
He <S%H4900>draws<s%> also the <S%H47>mighty<s%> with his <S%H3581>power<s%>: he rises <S%H6965>up<s%>, and no man is <S%H539>sure<s%> of <S%H2416>life<s%>.
Though it be <S%H5414>given<s%> him to be in <S%H983>safety<s%>, whereon he <S%H8172>rests<s%>; yet his <S%H5869>eyes<s%> are upon their <S%H1870>ways<s%>.

They are <S%H7426>exalted<s%> for a little <S%H4592>while<s%>, but are gone and brought <S%H4355>low<s%>; they are taken <S%H7092>out<s%> of the <S%H1870>way<s%> as all <S%H5243>other<s%>, and cut off as the <S%H7218>tops<s%> of the ears of <S%H7641>corn<s%>.
And if it be not so <S%H645>now<s%>, who will <S%H7760>make<s%> me a <S%H3576>liar<s%>, and <S%H7760>make<s%> my <S%H4405>speech<s%> nothing <S%H408>worth<s%>?
